What Happens if a Rented Printer Breaks Down?

July 1, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Renting a printer can be a smart choice for businesses of all sizes. It offers flexibility, cost savings, and access to the latest technology without the burden of ownership. But one common concern for many is this: What happens if a rented printer breaks down?

In this post, weâ€™ll walk you through what to expect when technical issues arise, how printer rental providers typically handle breakdowns, and whatâ€™s included in your rental agreement. Whether you're a startup, an SME, or an enterprise, it's important to know what support you'll get when things go wrong.

Understanding Printer Rental Agreements

Before we dive into the repair process, itâ€™s helpful to understand the basics of printer rental. A rental agreement is a contract between you and the provider, outlining the terms, costs, and services included.

Most reputable providers include maintenance and repair as part of the package. That means youâ€™re not left alone when the printer malfunctions.

ðŸ‘‰ Learn more: What is Included in a Printer Rental Agreement?

Common Reasons Printers Break Down

Just like any other equipment, printers are subject to wear and tear. Here are a few common reasons for breakdowns:

  • Paper jams or feeding issues

  • Ink or toner problems

  • Fuser unit malfunctions

  • Driver or software compatibility issues

  • Power or connectivity problems

Fortunately, when youâ€™re renting, these arenâ€™t your burden to fix alone.

What Happens If a Rented Printer Breaks Down?

1. Call for Support

The first step is to contact your rental providerâ€™s support team. Most rental companies, including Marga Enterprises, offer dedicated customer service hotlines or ticketing systems for quick response.

Be ready to provide:

  • Your contract or equipment number

  • A description of the issue

  • Any error messages appearing on the printer

  • Steps you've already tried to resolve it

2. Troubleshooting Over the Phone or Online

In many cases, your provider may guide you through basic troubleshooting remotely. Simple issues like restarting the printer, clearing paper jams, or checking toner levels can often be fixed on the spot.

However, if the issue is more serious, a technician will be scheduled to visit.

3. Onsite Technician Visit

If remote troubleshooting doesnâ€™t resolve the problem, expect an onsite visit. Most providers offer next-business-day or same-day service, especially if the equipment is covered under a full-service rental agreement.

The technician will:

  • Diagnose the issue

  • Replace faulty parts if necessary

  • Test the printer for full functionality

4. Replacement If Not Repairable

If the printer is beyond repair or will take too long to fix, a good rental company will replace the unitâ€”at no additional cost to you. This minimizes your downtime and keeps your operations running smoothly.

Are Repairs and Replacements Covered?

Yes, usually they are. The repair and replacement policy should be clearly stated in your rental agreement. Most full-service rentals include:

  • Free technical support

  • Scheduled preventive maintenance

  • On-demand repairs

  • Replacement equipment for major breakdowns

What If the Breakdown Is Due to User Error?

This depends on the rental provider. Minor mistakes, like paper orientation issues or using low-quality paper, are typically forgiven. However, deliberate damage or negligence might not be covered. In such cases, you may be charged for parts or repairs.

Always:

  • Follow the manufacturerâ€™s guidelines

  • Train staff on proper printer use

  • Avoid tampering with the internal components

How Long Will It Take to Get It Fixed?

This varies depending on the issue and provider. Most minor problems can be resolved within a few hours, while hardware replacement might take 1â€“2 days.

Factors affecting repair speed:

  • Availability of spare parts

  • Your location

  • Time of report (weekend vs. weekday)

Some providers offer backup units or allow you to extend your rental at no cost during downtimes.

ðŸ‘‰ Learn more: How Long Can I Rent a Printer For?

What Should You Do While Waiting?

Here are a few steps to manage downtime:

  • Notify your team and switch to digital workflows if possible

  • Use other available office printers

  • Request a temporary backup unit from your rental company

  • Prioritize critical printing tasks once service is restored

Tips to Avoid Frequent Breakdowns

Prevention is better than repair. Follow these best practices to reduce printer issues:

  • Schedule regular maintenance (most rental providers handle this)

  • Use quality paper and ink

  • Avoid overloading the tray

  • Keep the printer clean and dust-free

  • Train your staff on proper handling

Is Printer Rental Still Worth It?

Absolutely. Even with the risk of occasional breakdowns, renting remains a cost-effective and worry-free optionâ€”especially when compared to owning and maintaining your own device.

Hereâ€™s why businesses prefer rental:

  • No large upfront cost

  • Flexible rental terms

  • Access to new models and technology

  • Fast repair and support services

ðŸ‘‰ Find out: How Much Does Printer Rental Cost?

Final Thoughts

So, what happens if a rented printer breaks down? Youâ€™re covered. With a reliable rental provider, technical problems donâ€™t have to slow down your business. From remote support to onsite service and quick replacements, your provider takes care of the hassle so you can stay focused on your work.

When choosing a printer rental company, always check:

  • What's included in the agreement

  • Their response time

  • Availability of replacement units

  • Customer reviews and reputation

Renting a printer gives you peace of mindâ€”and when something goes wrong, itâ€™s their job to make it right.
